title: Danny Dyer's concerned mum 'begged Alan Carr not to let him get drunk' on chat show
text:
Danny Dyer's concerned mum 'begged Alan Carr not to let him get drunk' on chat show Christina has spoken out after her famous son was given a break from EastEnders Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Danny Dyer talks drinking in the Queen Vic after filming Share this video Get soaps updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Danny Dyer's mum has spoken out about his alleged drunken antics. 
Christina claims she had concerned about her famous son's boozing long before he was forced to take a step back from his role in EastEnders . 
In fact, she raised the issue with Alan Carr last year before the actor appeared on his New Year's Eve special. 
According to The Sun, she reportedly begged the presenter: "Do not, I repeat, do not get my son p tonight. You have been warned." Danny Dyer's mum has spoken out about his alleged drunken antics (Photo: BBC) 
Christine explained that she was worried he would make the same mistakes he made on the previous year's show, which saw Danny slate the Royal Family and target then Prime Minister David Cameron , stating: "I don't believe he's got a c**k." 
Despite her warnings, the EastEnders star still appeared pretty drunk as he exposed his testicle to Alan and fellow celebrity guest Mel B. 
"Danny went through every alcohol stage during the six-hour record, from fun drunk to silly drunk, morose drunk, angry drunk and slumped drunk, and ended by flashing his surprisingly large ball bag at me and Mel B," the presenter said. Read More Alan Carr was urged by Danny's mum not to give her son alcohol (Photo: WENN) 
Mirror Online has contacted Alan's rep for comment about Christina's claims. 
Danny confessed in December that he had tried to give up alcohol at the start of the month but failed. 
He said: “The beginning of the year is a month ago now. I mean, I did try to give up drinking but — as you can see — I’m now sucking on a lager." 
Clearly, he still hasn't achieved his goal to give up boozing as the 39-year-old actor, who plays Mick Carter, was spotted supping a couple of beers as he jetted out to South Africa on February 10 after being given a break from EastEnders. Read More Danny is on a break from EastEnders 
However, he has vowed to properly rest for the sake of his family. 
A source said: “Danny knows he has to rest-up and recuperate. He has been ground down by the workload on EastEnders and then partying on top of it. 
“This trip is going to do him the world of good. He can remain anonymous there and he can properly rest." The actor has vowed to properly rest for the sake of his family (Photo: FameFlynet) Like us on Facebook
